Description: Limestone shabti of Djehutymes with a short striated wig, a modelled face and crossed hands(very worn); the figure wears a garment with elbow-length sleeves and a pleated triangular apron; column of Hieroglyphic text down the front of the apron and six rows at the back separated with red lines; the feet(one now lost) are shod in sandals and separated by a block; plinth below.
Condition: fair - surface worn; one foot lost
